snippet: A new analysis found that each daily increase of three ounces of red meat was associated with a 16 percent increased risk of cardiovascular death and a 10 percent increased risk of cancer death.
abstract: Dr Frank B Hu study in Archives of Internal Medicine finds that eating red meat is associated with a sharply increased risk of death from cancer and heart disease.
lead_paragraph: A new analysis found that each daily increase of three ounces of red meat was associated with a 16 percent increased risk of cardiovascular death and a 10 percent increased risk of cancer death.

headline.seo: Red Meat Linked to Cancer and Heart Disease
headline.main: Risks: More Red Meat, More Mortality
headline.print_headline: Risks: More Red Meat, More Mortality
